isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9800 - LIFT CAB MECHANICALLY (WITH HOIST)

svcproc.title: LIFT CAB MECHANICALLY (WITH HOIST)
svcproc.para: To lift the cab to make the necessary hydraulic repairs, use the following procedures.

caution.para: If the hydraulic system must be opened for replacement or repairs, make sure an overhead hoist is available. Keep dirt or other contaminants from entering the hydraulic system. Do not attempt to mechanically pull the cylinders to retract or extend as pressure at the cylinder port is required to release cylinder check valves. Cylinder damage may result from the mechanical pull.

step1.para: With cab in down position, remove both left and right lift cylinders ( Item 34, Figure 90) from upper hinge brackets ( Items 6 and 47, Figure 90). This can be done by turning the steering wheel to the left and right to have access to lift cylinder pivot pins. Remove lift cylinder pivot pins, washers and cotter pins ( Item 7, Figure 90). Cylinder will fall free from upper hinge brackets.

Using a chain or lift strap ( Item 2, Figure 91) connected to a lift hoist, place chain or lift strap hooks ( Item 3, Figure 91) so they lock under back of cab. Place a suitable piece of wood ( Item 4, Figure 91) between cab and lift hook to avoid damage to back of cab.

caution.para: Make sure that lift hooks, when placed at back of cab floor, DO NOT catch or pinch any of the lines that are routed in that area.

step1.para: Using a lift hoist, lift cab slowly only to the point where you have enough room to do your necessary repairs to the hydraulic system.

note.para: Use a suitable alternate safety prop to support the cab.

step1.para: After repairs are made, remove alternate safety prop. Lower cab; leave lift chain or lift strap ( Item 2, Figure 91) attached.

Attach left and right side lift cylinders ( Item 34, Figure 90) to upper hinge brackets ( Items 6 and 47, Figure 90). It may be necessary to raise cab slightly with the hoist to align cylinder pivot pin holes with upper hinge bracket holes. Install pivot pins, washers and cotter pins ( Item 7, Figure 90). Remove chain or lift strap ( Item 2, Figure 91) from back of cab.

Check cab operation. It may be necessary to bleed the cab hydraulic lift system. Refer to MAINTENANCE, BLEEDING CAB TILT HYDRAULIC SYSTEM
.
